unnormalised: **Telecom Companies Announce Data Plan Revisions Amidst Rising Demand**
normalised: telecom companies announce data plan revisions amidst rising demand

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – October 26, 2023 – Leading telecom operators, Airtel, Jio, and Vodafone Idea, have announced revisions to their data plans, citing increased network strain and the need for infrastructure upgrades. The changes, effective November 15th, will see a slight increase in the price of popular pre-paid plans.
normalised: new delhi, india – october twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – leading telecom operators, airtel, jio, and vodafone idea, have announced revisions to their data plans, citing increased network strain and the need for infrastructure upgrades. the changes, effective november fifteenth, will see a slight increase in the price of popular pre-paid plans.

unnormalised: For example, the Rs. 499 plan will now cost Rs. 549, offering the same 2GB daily data allowance. However, Jio's new "Dhamaka" plan promises 3GB daily data for Rs. 666, valid for 84 days. Analysts at IIT Bombay predict these changes will impact lower-income users significantly.
normalised: for example, the rupee four hundred and ninety nine plan will now cost rupee five hundred and forty nine, offering the same two gigabyte daily data allowance. however, jio's new "dhamaka" plan promises three gigabyte daily data for rupee six hundred and sixty six, valid for eighty four days. analysts at I I T bombay predict these changes will impact lower-income users significantly.

unnormalised: The move comes as data consumption soars, fueled by increased streaming of content on platforms like Netflix and the growing popularity of short-form video apps. Experts suggest the increased data usage can be compared to the 'DDLJ' era, only this time everyone is watching on their smartphones. Telecommunication Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is closely monitoring the situation to ensure fair pricing and consumer protection. Further reports indicate investment in 5G infrastructure is ongoing, with over 10,000 km of fiber optic cable deployed this year alone.
